reviewText: I am waiting for my copy of this to ship so I have not seen the bonus songs, but I saw the airing on PBS and this is a very strong concert by some fantastic performers. Highly recommended. My two favorite numbers are The Apple Doesn't Fall Far From the Tree and New York, New York. I will update this when I view the bonus songs.

In the box I received was a Care Bear CD and not "First You Dream"

I am very upset about this issue
Perfection
Great music

A must have if you are a fan of Kander & Ebb. Filled the great singers interpatating
the songs in their own unique way.
Was great to hear these songs sung by others that the original performers.
Kander & Ebb write top notch music.  Real strong voices in the cast.  Thanks  C. fogg
I guess it's just kind of sad that Liza Minnelli was not able to participate in this. Kander and Ebb created her.
THERE IS A SPOT WHERE THE DVD STOPS AND RESTARTS-VERY ANNOYING
well done and most enjoyable.

A wonderful collection of great Kander and Ebb songs performed by a ridiculously talented group of performers. The chemistry between the cast is palpable. It is clear that they were so thrilled to get the chance to film this show. (For those of you that don't know, 5 of the 6 performers did the full-length version of this show together in 2009.)

In addition to what played on PBS, this DVD's bonus features includes some of my favorite moments of this show -- such as the unbelievable "The Money Tree/Maybe This Time" duet/"belt off" by Julia Murney and Heidi Blickenstaff.

Its sort of a Side by Side by Sondheim for Kander & Ebb, with Kate Baldwin, Heidi Blickenstaff, James Clow, Norm Lewis, Julia Murney, and Matthew Scott. The title comes from the Steel Pier song "First You Dream. This is an excellent PBS production, and a wonderful introduction to Kander & Ebb. Those who are familiar with their work won't find any rare songs or long-forgotten jems; however, the singer/actors are first rate and the arrangements are upbeat.

Great video- I actually saw this revue when when it was at Signature Theater in Arlington VA a few years ago and really enjoyed it then.  This is a great version of it - strong vocals, full orchestra, and well staged.  Highly recommended!
Love this collection and ensemble! I only wish this featured more songs. If you buy this, don't forget to watch the "bonus" tracks.

Excellent talent on show. But what is wrong with PBS......they produce a concert but only put some of the content in....and put the rest in extra content. A weird practice making this less than it should be.
Good selection of songs by the Broadway stars.  Good evening's entertainment
Really enjoyable showcase for some of their greatest songs, polished to perfection by a very talented group of singers.

Not nearly as good as "And the World Goes Round." Performers
are technically excellent, but the staging and song selections
are rather pedestrian. How can they cut a 2.5 hour show into 50 minutes?
Love this so much, wish it was longer but it's fabulous.
Sound and video quality excellent. Performances stellar!

Rather BORING....the performances were technically very good but were not all that engaging....
